#snsinstitutions #snsdesignthinkers #designthinking Uses of Logical Operators: â€¢ Logical operators perform logical operations on a given expression by joining two or more expressions or conditions. â€¢ It can be used in various relational and conditional expressions. â€¢ This operator is based on Boolean values to logically check the condition, and if the conditions are true, it returns 1. Otherwise, it returns 0 (False). â€¢ In C programming, logical operators are classified into three types such as the logical AND (&&) operator, the logical OR operator (||), and the logical NOT (!) operator.

: ++Example of procedural programming in c #include <iostream> using namespace std; int main() { int i, fact = 1, num; cout << "Enter any Number: "; cin >> number; for (i = 1; i <= num; i++) { fact = fact * i; } cout << "Factorial of " << num << " is: " << fact << endl; return 0; }

Programming #CCode #Question #ExplanationNeeded Hey everyone! ðŸ‘‹ Can someone explain this C code snippet to me? int main (int argc, char *argv[]) int x = 7; printf( " %d and %d \n", x++, x); return 0; It seems like this code outputs "7 and 8," but why does it happen ðŸ˜•? What's the reason behind the unexpected result of "8 and 7" in this code s... Source: https://lnkd.in/g_PJScxa #mymetric360

How do you print an inverted star pyramid in C programming? In this section, we'll examine how to print an inverted pyramid using the C language. Here are a few instances. visit https://bit.ly/47V2TJG for more information

Daily log: Day #13 of #100daysofALXSE C programming, going in again! Now, why do we have this type of function declaration, int main(void)? We are telling C that, we want a function, that returns an integer, where 0 means the script was executed successfully, 1, if it failed, but we are not going to give you any argument/variable. And in this function, use puts to print a string. Whew, we're getting somewhere. #100daysofcode #100daysofcodechallenge #c #cprogramming #clanguage

while and do-while loops in C programming: #cforembeddedsystems In the world of C programming, mastering control flow structures is essential, and the 'while' and do-while loops are fundamental constructs that every C programmer should be well-acquainted with.
